page.title: 10Hurworth House
page.content: Hurworth House Preparatory School. Hurworth House, built in 1720, opened as a fee paying school in 1946.It stands on a 2 acre site on which hall, changing rooms, classrooms and a small open air swimming pool have been built.Playing fields are nearby.There are 156 on the roll.8 are full time boarders, whose parents live abroad, and 15 board weekly.Day boys come from a 20 mile radius.Juniors (4-8 years) work from 9am-3.30pm, seniors (8-13) work 9am-5pm.They also work Saturday mornings.21 teachers, including peripatetics, prepare the boys for the Common Entrance Exam.Boys then go to public schools, mainly Barnard Castle,Durham School and Sedberg. Uniform - navy blue/light blue.Badge - stag's head.Motto - Fortuna jubat fortes.Headmaster - Mr G N Burgess.
